mnemonic: COR sounds like CORE - the CORE color!
cultural_note: 'Qual é a sua cor favorita?' is a common conversation starter!
example1_pt: Qual é a sua cor favorita?

cultural_note: Red is associated with Benfica football club - passionate fans!

mnemonic: AZUL sounds like 'a-ZOOL' - think AZURE blue!
grammar_notes: Same form for masculine and feminine.
cultural_note: Blue tiles ('azulejos') are Portugal's signature decorative art!
'Vinho verde' (green wine) is young Portuguese white wine!
Yellow trams in Lisbon are iconic - elétrico 28!
'Vinho branco' (white wine) is perfect with seafood in Portugal!

mnemonic: PRETO = PRAY-too - think PRETty black cat!
cultural_note: 'Café preto' (black coffee) - the Portuguese way to drink it!

mnemonic: LARANJA = la-RAN-ja - same as the fruit ORANGE!
grammar_notes: Same for masculine/feminine. Also means the fruit!
cultural_note: Portugal's Algarve region is famous for oranges - 'laranjas do Algarve'!
tip: Same for masc/fem - also the fruit!

mnemonic: ROSA sounds like ROSE - pink like a ROSE!
grammar_notes: Same for masculine/feminine. Also means 'rose' flower.
cultural_note: Pink is popular in Portuguese fashion and interior design.

grammar_notes: European Portuguese. Brazil uses 'marrom'. Feminine: castanha.
cultural_note: 'Olhos castanhos' (brown eyes) - most common eye color in Portugal.

grammar_notes: European Portuguese. Brazil uses 'cinza'. Feminine: cinzenta.
cultural_note: Rainy Lisbon days are 'cinzentos' but the city is still charming!

mnemonic: ROXO = HO-sho - think 'HO' for royalty purple!
cultural_note: Purple was historically royal - Porto's wine has a deep 'roxo' color!
